sentences.sContent: The room had several pictures on the walls.
sentences.sCn: 那个房间墙上有几幅画。

sentences.sContent: a book with pictures in it
He asked her permission to paint her picture (= paint a picture of her ) .
sentences.sCn: 他请求她允许为她画像。

sentences.sContent: ...Life Reimagined paints a picture of middle age that is far from gloomy...
...How vivid is the picture to show the young generations’ dependence on high technologies such as the phone...
...the man in the picture uses a laptop at work and home...
...the picture is clear: bynot cooking athome...
...They paint a picture of a world in which individuals...
...Taking the picture presented above as a case in point...
...The picture shows us a dialogue between a father and a son...
...The picture implicitly raises the question of the importance of the fundamental skills us students learn in our classes...
...Just as the teacher in the picture puts...
...the symbolical meaning of this picture is to show us the importance of reading literature...

synos.tran: 照片，图画；影片；景色；化身

phrases.pCn: 是…的化身；与…非常相像；十足…的样子
照相；落井钻具顶部打模
大图像；重点；（事情的）主要部分；特种宽银幕电影
逼真模式；栩栩如生的描写
不相干的；不合适；不在画面里的
文字图片；精彩生动的口头描述

words.tran: 独特的；生动的；别致的；图画般的

trans.tranOther: shapes, lines etc painted or drawn on a surface, showing what someone or something looks like
to show someone or something in a photograph, painting, or drawing
